intro: Pseudocymopterus tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leafed pseudocymopterus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural study.
